channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Grokking: Generalization Beyond Overfitting on Small Algorithmic Datasets
item.description: In this paper we propose to study generalization of neural networks on small algorithmically generated datasets.

item.title: LLM4Decompile: Decompiling Binary Code with Large Language Models
item.description: Therefore, we release the first open-access decompilation LLMs ranging from 1B to 33B pre-trained on 4 billion tokens of C source code and the corresponding assembly code.

item.title: Chronos: Learning the Language of Time Series
item.description: We introduce Chronos, a simple yet effective framework for pretrained probabilistic time series models.

item.title: Follow-Your-Click: Open-domain Regional Image Animation via Short Prompts
item.description: Despite recent advances in image-to-video generation, better controllability and local animation are less explored.

item.title: Less is More: Removing Text-regions Improves CLIP Training Efficiency and Robustness
item.description: In this paper, we discuss two effective approaches to improve the efficiency and robustness of CLIP training: (1) augmenting the training dataset while maintaining the same number of optimization steps, and (2) filtering out samples that contain text regions in the image.

item.title: GSPMD: General and Scalable Parallelization for ML Computation Graphs
item.description: We present GSPMD, an automatic, compiler-based parallelization system for common machine learning computations.

item.title: GiT: Towards Generalist Vision Transformer through Universal Language Interface
item.description: Due to its simple design, this paradigm holds promise for narrowing the architectural gap between vision and language.

item.title: Score-Guided Diffusion for 3D Human Recovery
item.description: We present Score-Guided Human Mesh Recovery (ScoreHMR), an approach for solving inverse problems for 3D human pose and shape reconstruction.

item.title: pyvene: A Library for Understanding and Improving PyTorch Models via Interventions
item.description: Interventions on model-internal states are fundamental operations in many areas of AI, including model editing, steering, robustness, and interpretability.

item.title: Interpretability in the Wild: a Circuit for Indirect Object Identification in GPT-2 small
item.description: Research in mechanistic interpretability seeks to explain behaviors of machine learning models in terms of their internal components.

item.title: Relaxing Accurate Initialization Constraint for 3D Gaussian Splatting
item.description: Through extensive analysis of SfM initialization in the frequency domain and analysis of a 1D regression task with multiple 1D Gaussians, we propose a novel optimization strategy dubbed RAIN-GS (Relaxing Accurate Initialization Constraint for 3D Gaussian Splatting), that successfully trains 3D Gaussians from random point clouds.

item.title: Fast Inner-Product Algorithms and Architectures for Deep Neural Network Accelerators
item.description: We introduce a new algorithm called the Free-pipeline Fast Inner Product (FFIP) and its hardware architecture that improve an under-explored fast inner-product algorithm (FIP) proposed by Winograd in 1968.

item.title: DynamiCrafter: Animating Open-domain Images with Video Diffusion Priors
item.description: Animating a still image offers an engaging visual experience.

item.title: DeepSeek-VL: Towards Real-World Vision-Language Understanding
item.description: The DeepSeek-VL family (both 1. 3B and 7B models) showcases superior user experiences as a vision-language chatbot in real-world applications, achieving state-of-the-art or competitive performance across a wide range of visual-language benchmarks at the same model size while maintaining robust performance on language-centric benchmarks.

item.title: Isotropic3D: Image-to-3D Generation Based on a Single CLIP Embedding
item.description: As a result, with a single image CLIP embedding, Isotropic3D is capable of generating multi-view mutually consistent images and also a 3D model with more symmetrical and neat content, well-proportioned geometry, rich colored texture, and less distortion compared with existing image-to-3D methods while still preserving the similarity to the reference image to a large extent.

item.title: ORPO: Monolithic Preference Optimization without Reference Model
item.description: While recent preference alignment algorithms for language models have demonstrated promising results, supervised fine-tuning (SFT) remains imperative for achieving successful convergence.

item.title: GLiNER: Generalist Model for Named Entity Recognition using Bidirectional Transformer
item.description: Named Entity Recognition (NER) is essential in various Natural Language Processing (NLP) applications.

item.title: Data Interpreter: An LLM Agent For Data Science
item.description: Large Language Model (LLM)-based agents have demonstrated remarkable effectiveness.

item.title: DragAnything: Motion Control for Anything using Entity Representation
item.description: We introduce DragAnything, which utilizes a entity representation to achieve motion control for any object in controllable video generation.

item.title: FeatUp: A Model-Agnostic Framework for Features at Any Resolution
item.description: Deep features are a cornerstone of computer vision research, capturing image semantics and enabling the community to solve downstream tasks even in the zero- or few-shot regime.
